comment.author: 7225349@N03
comment._content: The scene is in Waterford but the cars are from Wexford, judging by the registration plates MI codes were issued for County Wexford from 1903, Waterford had KI.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Think one of the men is a Mr Meardon, who seemed to own or manage the Bunmahon (Bonmahon) Mines in Waterford around this time. It'd be really interesting to know if he lived in Wexford, but "commuted" to work...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 62250332@N05
comment._content: muy bonita saludos de Teresa

comment.author: 30484128@N03
comment._content: Another excellent glimpse into a past time.

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Waterford county had KI . Waterford city had WI, Kilkenny had IP, Tipp south had HI.These were all issued by the British ministry in sequence of some kind. Someplace in England had KJ for instance. I think it was Oxford.

comment.author: 60812213@N04
comment._content: Bunmahon was known as the centre of the Copper Coast, where mines operated by the Dublin Mining Co. mined the copper and lead ore that was shipped out to Wales.

comment.author: 35727396@N03
comment._content: Heart skipped a beat then - my name is Routledge, formerly Rutledge but I am sure my ancestors were from the north, Fermanagh/Mayo. I will continue my tour of your excellent site!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/35727396@N03] Thank you! From searching the online census for 1901 and 1911, it looks as if Routledge was very rare. Far more Rutledges, but still not a very common name which is always a bonus if you're doing your family history.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
